name: DynatracePushDeploymentEvent
description: This build and release task sends a deployment event to Dynatrace
author: Abel Wang
helpMarkDown: Replace with markdown to show in help

inputs.name: dtToken
inputs.label: Dynatrace API Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: API token for your Dynatrace Tenant

inputs.name: entityType
inputs.label: Entity Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: The entity type of the app being monitored

inputs.name: deploymentName
inputs.label: Deployment Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The deployment name. This should be name of release definition.

inputs.name: deploymentVersion
inputs.label: Deployment Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The deployment version. This should release id.

inputs.name: deploymentProject
inputs.label: Deployment Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the team project

inputs.name: ciLink
inputs.label: CI LInk
inputs.helpMarkDown: Where the release is coming from. This value should be the VSTS url

inputs.name: jenkinsUrl
inputs.label: VSTS URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Where the release is coming from. This value should be the VSTS url

inputs.name: gitCommit
inputs.label: Git Commit
inputs.helpMarkDown: Commit id that kicked off the build/release. Alias default is _<name of the build>. You can find the build alias by looking at the artifcats in the release pipeline.
